title: Three-week-old baby dies after being stabbed with mum at home
text:
A baby has died following a stabbing in North Tynside (Picture: North News & Pictures Ltd north)

A three-week-old baby has died after being stabbed at home with his mother in Wallsend, North Tyneside.

Emergency services were called to the Portland Close property on Wednesday, October 2, where they found a woman, 21, and her child suffering from life-threatening injuries.

Both were rushed to hospital and the baby boy remained in a critical condition for several days.

Medics said the youngster required round-the-clock care, but despite the best efforts of staff he died on October 6.

His mother is now said to be in a stable condition.

Denis Erdinch Beytula, 27, was arrested (Picture: North News & Pictures Ltd north)

He will appear at Newcastle Crown Court on October 31

A man, known to the victims, has been charged with two counts of attempted murder.

Denis Erdinch Beytula, 27, of Portland Close, Wallsend, appeared in North Tyneside Magistrates’ Court last week and will appear at Newcastle Crown Court on October 31.

Detective Chief Inspector Dave Cole, of Northumbria Police, said: ‘This is a devastating time for the baby’s family.

‘Specialist officers continue to offer them support and I know the community in Wallsend are by their side too.

‘It is impossible to imagine what they are going through and I would ask the public to continue to respect the family’s privacy at this time.

The baby’s mum is now in a stable condition (Picture: North News & Pictures Ltd north)

A forensics team working at the scene (Picture: North News & Pictures Ltd north)

Anyone with information is urged to contact police (Picture: North News & Pictures Ltd north)

‘A man has been charged in relation to the incident and we will continue to work closely with the Crown Prosecution Service (CPS) as the case moves forward.’

Police are still appealing for anyone with information about the stabbing to come forward.

Officers can be contacted on 101 and quoting log 539 02/10/19.
